item.title: SEGA trademarks Skies of Arcadia, Eternal Arcadia in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/sega-trademarks-skies-of-arcadia-eternal-arcadia-in-japan

SEGA filed trademarks for “Skies of Arcadia” and “Eternal Arcadia” on January 16 in Japan, which were made public on January 24.

Skies of Arcadia, known as Eternal Arcadia in Japan, is a turn-based RPG originally released for Dreamcast on October 5, 2000,. An enhanced GameCube version titled Skies of Arcadia Legends, or Eternal Arcadia Legends, followed on December 26, 2002. The game has never been ported or remastered for newer platforms, despite high fan demand.

Here is an overview of the original game and Legends, via the back of their boxes:

Skies of Arcadia

The skies’ the limit!

Follow the adventures of Vyse as he journeys through uncharted skies to discover new continents and explore mystical ruins. Accompanied by Aika and Fina, he will wage epic battles against savage monsters, evil Pirates, and a powerful enemy nation. An RPG experience unlike any other awaits you.

  • Full 3D world with highly imaginative storyline, beautifully detailed graphics and immersive gameplay.
  • Customize your own airship with up to 22 crew members.
  • Hand-to-hand and ship-to-ship combat featuring spectacular spell effects, and amazing special attacks.

Skies of Arcadia Legends

Become legend of piracy.

Take the helm and gain renown in this vast role-playing voyage across spectacular and ever changing worlds.

  • An improved battle engine with hours of new gameplay.
  • New “Wanted” Battles, new characters, and more…
  • Customize your own airship and enlist up to 22 crew members.
  • Fight with over 70 weapons and 36 magical skills in staggering ship-to-ship combat.

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero, Cuisineer, more
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-phantom-brave-the-lost-hero-cuisineer-more

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

RPG Maker WITH, Hello Kitty Island Adventure, Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O., etc.

Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch, and Cuisineer for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Also due out this week are the physical editions of Black Myth: Wukong and Honkai: Star Rail for PlayStation 5, the PlayStation versions of RPG Maker WITH, the Switch and PC versions of Hello Kitty Island Adventure, and the PC versions of Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 and Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • Arranger: A Role-Puzzling Adventure (Switch) – Already available worldwide.
  • Black Myth: Wukong (PS5) – Already available worldwide.
  • Cardfight!! Vanguard Dear Days 2 (Switch) – Launching digitally worldwide.
  • Cuisineer (PS5, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch)
  • Honkai: Star Rail Trailblazer Edition (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5)
    • European Version (PS5)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero (PS5, PS4, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • Deluxe Edition (PS5, PS4, Switch)
    • North American Version (PS5, PS4, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, PS4, Switch)
  • RPG Maker WITH (PS5, PS4)
  • Sniper Elite 5 (New Price Version) (PS5)
  • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants Unleashed (Switch) – Already available worldwide.

Digital-Only

  • Botany Manor (PS5, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
  • Cardfight!! Vanguard Dear Days 2 (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Cuisineer (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Eternal Strands (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Genso Manege (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide alongside Switch version.
  • Gimmick! 2 (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One) – Launching worldwide.
  • Hello Kitty Island Adventure (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Laika: Aged Through Blood (Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 (PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap (Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • ReSetna (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • ROBOBEAT (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Sniper Elite: Resistance (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series / One)
      • Deluxe Edition (PS5, Xbox Series / One)
    • European Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series / One)
      • Deluxe Edition (PS5, Xbox Series / One)
  • Star Wars: Hunters Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • The Stone of Madness (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Tails of Iron II: Whiskers of Winter (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants Unleashed (PS5, PS4) – Already available worldwide.
  • Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Wayfinder (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Wizardry: The Five Ordeals (Switch) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000
